website_summaries.verdict: The Lexar MicroSD Reader is a handy tool to back up and transfer files on your iPhone or iPad.
pros: Easy to set up and use
cons: App drains phone or tablet battery life quickly

customer_reviews.title: Gradually dropped to bits, stopped working all together now in under 6 months.....
customer_reviews.text: Bought it 6 months ago. Worked well to start with, although the branded base dropped off very quickly, within the first couple of weeks of use. A month or so ago the closure mechanism broke, probably because the branded base plate held the mechanisms in place. Now the whole thing has stopped working. Cheap components so lasted six months.... I wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.author: K.T

customer_reviews.title: Not recognised by Windows 10, does not read cards.
customer_reviews.text: Had two, neither worked. Not recognised by Windows 10, no response to any XQD card inserted in either of them. Zero functionality. Card fits fine, unit is seemingly built well enough. But it might as well have been a brick for all the use it was. Got a refund without any quibbling so full marks for service, zero marks for quality of product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Nicely presented fast card reader
customer_reviews.text: Excellent reader in a very convenient package. The pop up reader seems to be high quality plastic and hopefully will last the course. So far it has read all of my Compact flash and SD cards flawlessly. I am not a great techy but it certainly seems much faster than my old reader. Will update after a few months use.
customer_reviews.author: Phill993

customer_reviews.title: useful handy thing to have
customer_reviews.text: the best thing i’ve ever dreamed of. using that for transfering footage from my gopro to ipad, into dropbox folder. easy to copy, but have to turn “auto block function off” as copying is cancelled when screen is locked. very quick uploading into dropbox aswell. before that i used my laptop’s card reader and then ages copying to dropbox and waiting when files will be uploaded and it will free the laptop storage.
customer_reviews.author: Moa

customer_reviews.title: The fist one didn't work, simply not recognised on ...
customer_reviews.text: The fist one didn't work, simply not recognised on USB. Amazon very quickly replaced it with an identical unit that... did not work. (Tried 2 PCs and a laptop, USB 3 and 2, it is not a duff USB port thing.) So that one went back and Amazon quickly replaced it with.. another duffer. Am now very sceptical of Lexar, would not dare buy a Sony reader (not Sony camera or card) so just read the files straight off the camera. Final score: Lexar 0 - Nikon 1.
customer_reviews.author: Endly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Have been using a cheaper reader and struggling with slow file transfers and I/O errors, but not knowing any better thought that was the norm with large files and my particular PC/network setup. Decided to take the plunge and spend a bit extra - plugged it in and the difference is amazing. Tasks which would have taken me hours last week took literally seconds. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: The best card reader hands Period!
customer_reviews.text: The best card reader I have ever owned, and I have been shooting digital for over 16 years! Its light compact but by far the best build quality of any card reader i have owned. It is also very cheap for the amount of cards yiuo can mount in there at one time. If you reading Lexar, I'd like to see a multiple CF card reader :)
customer_reviews.author: DJ AROXX

customer_reviews.title: Very fast reader and transfer rates with CF cards
customer_reviews.text: Very fast via USB ports when transferring to and from a CF card (as this is what it was predominately purchased for). Transfers at approx. 115 Mb/s to a solid state drive, the same speed my SSD transfers to an external HDD. One of the top card readers. Unable to give an opinion on SD card performance as I do not use them.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Superb build quality and FAST!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card reader to allow me to download photos from my Nikon D500. It downloaded so fast that I thought it had broken (but it hadn't - It worked perfectly) when you insert the card, it is totally flush with the reader and looks very neat. Its a push eject (rather than just pulling the card out) and this also gives it a quality feel. If you are going to spend lots of money on a good camera and an expensive XQD card - why spend the minimum on a card reader. I think I spent 27 quid which is much more than any SD card reader I ever bought - but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: UK_Greg

customer_reviews.title: Can not believe that such trademark as Lexar can be so bad. Item looks good but shame must be faulty
customer_reviews.text: On my first use, half of the images come up as "files cant be read" "info missing" Panic Panic Panic! Im professional photographer and my images ar very important. Tried again and again. Same. Then just got my old Kingston card reader, and thanks god, nothing wrong with the images or my memory card... Can not believe that such trademark as Lexar can be so bad. Item looks good but shame must be faulty.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy Meadow 007

customer_reviews.title: Vital to have after iOS 10 update.
customer_reviews.text: Since the iOS 10 update, my Samsung camera cannot wirelessly to my iPad to transfer my photos. I used to back them up this way every day whilst on holiday. This was the only reason I bought this camera, now useless since Apple block most open networks to iPads, iPhones etc. as a security measure. This little gadget has proved invaluable- it's very easy to use and fits easily into my camera case. Not all makes of cards are compatible,- I use Lexar cards in my camera now- but can back up as before. Fully recommend!
customer_reviews.author: zarafet

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Have been through so many of these card readers lately, probably my fault for going for cheaper ones in the past. THis tims I stumped up and paid more but it was well worth it. Works really well, basic but brilliant
customer_reviews.author: RanjK

customer_reviews.title: Well made and well designed, not expensive!
customer_reviews.text: Much better than those cheap things, this is a well designed reader, quite hefty and with a rubber base so it doesn't fly around your desk, and with all the slots - it can read 25 different formats apparently - in the front - some of those mini-readers have the CF card slot on the back, if they have one at all. Build quality is nice, with a nice white USB cable, and it matches the iMac! It can also copy from one card to another and speed appears to be good although i haven't tried everything just yet. Don't bother with the cheap boxes as this isn't expensive, and it's very good.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Laskey

customer_reviews.title: Snappy performance
customer_reviews.text: What a difference from my previous multi-card reader! The speed - presumably because of the USB 3 compatibility - is an order of magnitude faster than my previous unit. It's light and compact so ideal for taking on holiday for those crucial backups of your vacation snaps, and the fact that it closes down saves some space, if only a tiny amount.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R. Boutcher

customer_reviews.title: Everything, looks great and meets my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Everything, looks great and meets my expectations, I was pleased to see the quality, and it works well Exactly what I wanted, the product of excellent quality. very happy with the service and fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: John Jauert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product !
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed by this Lexar multicard reader. Solid strong product. Has a protective covering for storage. Push both square buttons on either side at the same time to open. Ordered it to read CF cards. Only one side of the CF card fits in. Gently push the card symmetrically with both thumbs while holding the reader with both hands. Takes in only about 1/3rd of the card. Blue light comes on and the download begins when USB is connected. USB 3 cable provided. Care is needed when inserting the card reader end of the cable, as it is split in 2 halves. Well worth the money !
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Works, but is a little slow
customer_reviews.text: It works, but it is incredibly slow compared to other card readers I've used. As a result, I'm using aninstead for my day to day work.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but likely to break
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's meant to, no questions asked there. But it feels so weak and likely to break very soon. I'd recommend you either attach a cable or get a reader that has a cable already attached, allowing the reader itself to sit firmly on the table.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great XQD Card Reader
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. XQD card reader , I was a bit sceptical looking at the very much more expensive Sony option . But this one works a treat with Sony XQD cards . Lightening fast .
customer_reviews.author: Mylers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. The XQD card locks into the slot with ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. The XQD card locks into the slot with push in push out. The XQD card actually goes all the way into the reader and does not stick out so the edge of your card sits flush with the edge of the card reader. It means you can turn it into a thumb drive if you so disire by leaving the card in placed. Much cheaper and smaller than the other card readers that are part of a modular system that Lexar sell.
customer_reviews.author: bullets

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the best cf card reader on the market!! Is so fast compared to my old usb 2 version, If you need a cf/sd reader then I would strongly recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: David Murray

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, fast card reader.
customer_reviews.text: I seem to have worked by way through quite a few cheaper card readers. Even supposed USB 3.0 readers have proved slow and I have had quicker transfer speeds by connecting the camera directly. This is the first reader I have used that delivers good transfer speeds, and it comes in a neat package. I have used this with both SD and CF cards up to 128Gb without issue.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: Card seats easily and securely.
customer_reviews.text: Having done some research I was unsure if this was the right CF card reader to buy. Let me assure you, it is awesome! It's well designed, functions as it should and the card seats easily and securely. Just what I needed and worth every penny. I've bought cheaper products in the past and none have lasted very long or worked very well, so this time I paid a bit more and got a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: WCS2719

customer_reviews.title: it gives you a fantastic edge over your competition
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Sports Photographer and with the nature of the Industry, Speed is key! The Lexar card reader delivers fast read and write speeds and when paired with the Professional memory cards, it gives you a fantastic edge over your competition. It's build quality is sturdy and it's design with the incorporated dust cover means that you don't have to worry about getting dirt or water into the card reader slots.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hiscott

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully designed and does exactly what is required...namely to quickly copy photographs or other data from the XQD card to the computers hard drive storage
customer_reviews.author: P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Does the job well for the sizes of card I use (which includes the largest where, all too often, the fit is too tight and risks bending the pins). It closes like a hinged box and keeps the slots clean. A neat design. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very rapid USB data transfer
customer_reviews.text: It works very well without the need for specialist drivers in Win 8 and 10 and the data speed of transfer for large RAW photo files is impressive. The design involves the black cardholder part popping up from the semi-opaque base. I suppose this might help exclude foreign bodies if you are a mucky soul but in truth it is just an unnecessary complication and potential frailty.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long!
customer_reviews.text: This multi card reader was working great, then I hit the 6th week of use and it stopped connecting to computer, kept ejecting itself (suggesting there is a fault) and then my computer shut down without warning after I plugged this reader into the machine. I am disappointed as I really liked it when it arrived, looked great, clean and easy to use card inserts and fairly speedy file transfer. I really need this for my work so have been let down as can't copy images onto mac until I have a new one. I am losing faith in internet purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Happy shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Works well and very useful but be careful. It is easy to bend it when attached to a phone or iPad. My first one stopped working due to this. But they replaced it without any quibbles very quickly so 10/10 for customer service. The software is the best I have seen for this type of product and I have tried a few.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T.Reis

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work brilliantly.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this for an older Canon camera (Canon don't update software for some older models), and a new Windows operating system (8.1). Absolutely no complaints. You pinch the body of the card reader at the sides to make it pop open, slip in the Compact Flash card, and within seconds photos download automatically. The camera prefers it if I then use the camera to delete the photos, rather than deleting them whilst the card is plugged into the computer. All very smooth!
customer_reviews.author: Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a backup - tried it and it doesn't work. No sign of card in finder. Tried with laptop also. Same thing. Bought in July but as a backup I assumed it worked as all Lexar stuff has done for 10 years (recent problems with both my XQD cards, however!). I spoke with Amazon who are replacing it, however, so lets hope that one works...
customer_reviews.author: NickH

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Pro version - Buy now before it's no longer made
customer_reviews.text: Great USB3.0 card reader. As a professional photographer and studio owner I sometimes get people asking me to read their memory cards. I have the Professional version that reads Compact flash and Secure Digital cards. I normally stay away from 25-1 card readers as historically they are poor. However this one is fantastic.. in fact in my tests it was as fast if not faster than the professional product. I'd recommend this one over the 'professional' version.
customer_reviews.author: GregThurtle

customer_reviews.title: Very fast and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Very fast and reliable reader. I have three of these now as I think they are the best available. The closing case is a nice addition as it helps keep dust out of the slots.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rix

customer_reviews.title: Very Good value
customer_reviews.text: These are great - works straight out of the box, nice small size not much of that all important desk real estate taken up. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Aidan

customer_reviews.title: Having read a poor review prior to buying this Reader
customer_reviews.text: Having read a poor review prior to buying this Reader, I have made sure not to handle it roughly, as it is prone to coming apart. I don't shut & open it, just leave it open. This ensures the moving parts remain intact. Other than this, I have had no problems & it works every time whichever card I insert. Overall it is nice to use.
customer_reviews.author: ANTONY J SUMMERS

customer_reviews.title: but they've been perfect, and I've had it a couple of years
customer_reviews.text: It's SO much faster copying gigabytes of drone footage via USB3 than USB2. Obviously. But I needed to say it. I've only used the SD and micro SD slots, but they've been perfect, and I've had it a couple of years, now.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Timm

customer_reviews.title: Great overall reader
customer_reviews.text: Glad I did plenty of research before buying one of these readers. This one has worked without problems from the word go, and with no interfacing issues with my PC. Lexar have been in the business a long time and may not be the cheapest but you definitely get what you pay for with these devices.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis P L Evanson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing from Lexar
customer_reviews.text: This product was ordered on the 5th of October 2015 - used about 20 times a year on average, today has stopped working. So stick with your USB cable to camera and save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Mr T

customer_reviews.title: Worth an extra bit of money rather than buying multiple cheap readers every few months or so when you inevitably bend a pin in the hurry to get things uploaded from that great shoot you just had
customer_reviews.text: Unlike most CF card readers these days, it's much harder to bend pins in this one since you have to push the CF card onto long rails before they reach the pin. Worth an extra bit of money rather than buying multiple cheap readers every few months or so when you inevitably bend a pin in the hurry to get things uploaded from that great shoot you just had.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Isserlis

customer_reviews.title: Works, but be persistent with the app.
customer_reviews.text: The adapter gives me many more film choices on long haul flights. The app which transfer files from micro reader to the idevice is not easy to use, but after a couple of attempts the transfers are successful.
customer_reviews.author: Moist

customer_reviews.title: A great little card reader
customer_reviews.text: I love this card reader. It's fast, it's compact and it does exactly what you want it to. As a full time professional photographer I use this daily and it hasn't once failed to get the images quickly from the card to the computer. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: It just works!
customer_reviews.text: Great device, unfortunately the original Lexar company are no more. 😪
customer_reviews.author: Foggyone

customer_reviews.title: Poor connection
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't impressed with this card reader, it kept disconnecting itself, I use card readers a lot and I wouldn't buy this one again. I had to do uploads multiple times as it would just stop as if the USB had been pulled out dispite nothing moving.
customer_reviews.author: KJN

customer_reviews.title: A solid Product Just works well
customer_reviews.text: A solid Product that Just works well a product you can keep for many years
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact my XQD card pushes in to lock. Push again to release. Like on my camera. Very quick to upload my images. It is a pity the Company are no longer producing memory cards as they are the best on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Simm-pa1960

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: The card reader looks very neat and tidy when not in use with its open and closed design. My main use is for reading compact flash cards and it is one of the best readers I've used for accepting cards. The USB 3.0 connection is an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: David Gregson

customer_reviews.title: Top Multi Card Reader
customer_reviews.text: Having previously used several mutli card readers, although this one is dearer, it is easily the best. The cards fit without the need to force them in and the transfer data speed is superb. I have been recommended Lexar on a photography website by many users and I can see the reason why.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Peter Young

customer_reviews.title: Simple but effective
customer_reviews.text: Simple and reliable card reader which has a hinged cover to keep dust out of the contacts. Fast image transfer with the right cards. Only downside I could find was that there is nowhere to store the cable on the reader. Otherwise full marks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very handy to have if you own an Apple device and GoPro.
customer_reviews.text: This has been ideal for getting my GoPro footage no my iPad Pro when out and about. So far no issues with it. Lost a star as its very expensive for what it is, but i guess you have to pay for quality.
customer_reviews.author: dave_bass5

customer_reviews.title: Works okay on Windows 8 up to a point, ...
customer_reviews.text: Works okay on Windows 8 up to a point, but not as fast is it says even on USB3 and keeps 'forgetting' its drive letters, and unless you manually assign each slot one, the cards in those slots won't display. It remembers them for a time or two, and then forgets them again. This didn't happen on XP. Corrupted all the info on one of my cards when tried in Linux Mint, luckily I had backed the card up on another machine. My old reader has no problems with any of my systems.
customer_reviews.author: A Wilson

customer_reviews.title: broke after light use and is poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Not great. I bought this in August 2016 and now it is broken after light use. Glue on the base panel is not strong enough to hold it in place so falls off and little springs behind it can get lost. I wouldn't recommend this product not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: trunk

customer_reviews.title: The Lexar Professional USB 3.0 Dual Slot Card Reader is excellent
customer_reviews.text: The Lexar Professional USB 3.0 Dual Slot Card Reader is excellent; beautifully made, and it does the job perfectly. I was attracted to Lexar through being impressed with their XQD Professional Card Reader which I also use in my photographic work. Great!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Neat and does the job
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly I only use the SD slot at the moment, but it's a compact design and I like the fact it folds down to keep dust out of the slots when not in use. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: D B HUMPHRIES

customer_reviews.title: Great card reader...providing decent usb cable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little card reader however my one slight problem with it is the usb cable it comes with. Mine came slightly bent and this caused a connection problem. Works fine with another cable.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Grindrod

customer_reviews.title: bit bulkier than I would have liked, they could have made it smaller
customer_reviews.text: bit bulkier than I would have liked, they could have made it smaller. Will be good for desktop users, but for travelling and carrying around all the time you may want to look at something smaller to save space in your laptop bag.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Mcintosh

customer_reviews.title: Works efficiently and to the high quality and speed I ...
customer_reviews.text: Works efficiently and to the high quality and speed I need. I had invested in a cheaper one, but 'buy cheap, buy twice'. I should have bought this one in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: boggy marsh

customer_reviews.title: Fast XQD card reader
customer_reviews.text: A well built essential bit of kit if you've an XQD card - does exactly what the specs say and its very fast when used with a USB 3.0 computer.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This Reader is Superb, A Bit Slow With SUB 2, But Not a Problem
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mr. Richings

customer_reviews.title: Quality Card reader
customer_reviews.text: Quality feel about this reader, Have a couple of Lexar Cards CF & SD and both cards Read very Fast as you would expect, Decent length of cable also, will update if any Problems
customer_reviews.author: Jonboy

customer_reviews.title: Nice design and very tidy on the desk
customer_reviews.text: So much faster than the built in slot on my Mac. Nice design and very tidy on the desk, very good price from the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Monty

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase for me! Used daily as a part of my busines and no complains.
customer_reviews.author: mr ioannis h crouch

customer_reviews.title: Great product and so so happy that it works great ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product and so so happy that it works great with my new 64Gb ScanDisk Extreme Pro CF Card, fast data transfer which is just what I needed when uploading 45Mb RAW files
customer_reviews.author: Richard Welch

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic card reader
customer_reviews.text: Love this card reader! Easy to use and handles so many different card types
customer_reviews.author: MegaSeb

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this so far
customer_reviews.text: Very well designed, very fast file transfer, no difficulties reading my CF cards (other card readers have been sticky about CF cards or just didn't read them at all). Very pleased with this so far.
customer_reviews.author: Zappa 55

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to read my sd and micro sd cards. It is compatible with almost all the common type cards It's really fast reading and writing, I love the design and the fact that is possible to close it and protect the card slots. Absolutely suggested.
customer_reviews.author: Paperino

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice item, as described. Quick delivery. Recommended seller. A+++
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, saves plugging in the camera every time
customer_reviews.author: IAN CARRY

customer_reviews.title: Recomended, fast and reponsive and looks nice
customer_reviews.text: Very Nice and responsive, Happy i got it yeas its a on the plastic side but if you look after it it will do you good. I have had it over 8 months i think and not 1 scratch.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: All the 5 star reviews you read on this product ...
customer_reviews.text: All the 5 star reviews you read on this product are true. I bought a cheap one that didn't even work from Amo but when I bought this one I was blown away by its nifty design. It's a well made product that transfers at lightening speed.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: product works very well but my experience is that they ...
customer_reviews.text: product works very well but my experience is that they do not last long before wear and tear starts to make them have problems with connections.
customer_reviews.author: The Captain

customer_reviews.title: Cracking bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: Cracking bit of kit. Fast transfer speed from a great name in tech. The top black unit retracts into the unit when not in use. Pressing both sides of the front makes the reader pop up ready to accept the card.
customer_reviews.author: Whistlewhileyouwork

customer_reviews.title: Good product for accessing memory cards
customer_reviews.text: This simple little box enabled me to find all the information on any of my memory cards. Good, simple and small.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia W.

customer_reviews.title: Lexar micro sd card reader
customer_reviews.text: Product exactly what I required, quick delivery, very nice and compact would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Williams

customer_reviews.title: Best CF Card reader with SD too.
customer_reviews.text: I already have one of these and as a lightning deal was easy to grab another to leave at my office. In my opinion this is the best CF Card Reader there is. A super fast read/write unit for my 64Gb 1200x SDXC cards too.
customer_reviews.author: D. S. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Totally reliable and rock steady
customer_reviews.text: Used constantly with SD cards and CF cards - Totally reliable and rock steady. Fast USB 3.0 (used with HP Desktop PC running Windows 7 and DELL XPS-15 Laptop running Windows 10)
customer_reviews.author: R.D Carver

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality 10/10
customer_reviews.text: Excellent built quality. I have used other card readers and inserting memory cards were like play "operation" (a game from the 80s). This one is precise and exact. Inserting cards are easy and there is no fear of damaging the cards at all.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Another good Lexar product.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of a number of Lexar products that I have bought over the years. Fast transfer speed, well thought out design, works a treat.
customer_reviews.author: Toppman

customer_reviews.title: Product is great, however Lexar application need some improvememts
customer_reviews.text: MicroSD card Adapter works great on Ipad Air 2. However Lexar App needs to be improved, because during the photo/video viewings it tends to shuts down the App.
customer_reviews.author: Deividas

customer_reviews.title: Easy no fuss
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, easy to use, fast transfer of images to hard drive. Worked first time used on imac Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Tony B

customer_reviews.title: Good portable unit
customer_reviews.text: Nice little unit even if it did take me a minute or two to figure out how to open it. Once you know, it's easy of course. Compact and portable, just right to accompany my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: El-Bandido

customer_reviews.title: Excellent card reader
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fast card reader. Great for quickly uploading my cf card raw files to my mac
customer_reviews.author: D M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, no issues with it at all. Fast transfer rate using the usb3 connection to my iMac and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Golden Orfe

customer_reviews.title: it reads cards ..
customer_reviews.text: Does the job on my MAC and Windows machine. No hassle bit if kit
customer_reviews.author: P. Jeffs

customer_reviews.title: Magic Lexar
customer_reviews.text: Excellent card reader, fast read and write. I bought three of them to give to my wife and sons.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Gordon Downie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent piece of kit .
customer_reviews.text: Like all the products I have made by Lexar excellent.Would reccommended
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent reader which nicely packs away - nice rubber base ...
customer_reviews.text: excellent reader which nicely packs away - nice rubber base stops it sliding all over the base as well - would greatly recommend
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShadow

customer_reviews.title: it has worked seamlessly from day one and I am confident it will prove to be a good buy.
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of photography and I wanted a card reader I could rely on. After using a couple of others that didn't come up to scratch. I decided to give this one a go and, although I haven't had it that long, it has worked seamlessly from day one and I am confident it will prove to be a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Emrys Babb

customer_reviews.title: Great USB 3 Card Reader @ a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to copy off footage from the SanDisk SDSDX-128G-X46 Extreme SDXC UHS SD card. Tried copying footage off under USB 2, a full card would take about 2.5 - 3hrs. With this baby it takes appprox 40 mins!
customer_reviews.author: Skeksis

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Completely unreliable, keeps becoming unresponsive during long writes. Had it for 5 weeks, already going to replace it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: This is the third time that I have bought one of these as I keep giving them away to my relatives as presents because they are so good.
customer_reviews.author: Minder

customer_reviews.title: Lexar USB3 Reader
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, needed the PCI USB3 card bought at the same time to have a power supply up and running. Very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compatible with lots of memory cards
customer_reviews.text: Fits lots of different cards. Easy to use when you work out how to open it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great reader.
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery. Used with compact flash card fast tranfer. Well built only need to light push card into reader. Flip lid to protect when not in use. Not the cheapest card reader I have had but for a first time use was impress 350 photos very quick will time and update review when used more. Worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Card Reader
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and very quick upload speed even with 14 bit RAW files thanks to the USB 3 connection, so easy to use and the lid pops back down when not in use for extra protection from dust etc.
customer_reviews.author: Garfield

customer_reviews.title: Does what is says it does.
customer_reviews.text: Necessary to use with QXD cards (needed for my new Nikon D500). Compact size. Only woish USB-C was more common and I could get a USB-C version and take advantage of teh increased transfer speed.
customer_reviews.author: David H London

customer_reviews.title: this is the business ideal for busy photographer who needs ...
customer_reviews.text: this is the business ideal for busy photographer who needs a quick download and relies on kit
customer_reviews.author: Trev Porter Photographer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Really nice quality product. Had several internal/external readers in the past; all failed in the end, very poorly constructed. One even managed to catch fire. This however is a solid, well made product which just works.
customer_reviews.author: Rab

customer_reviews.title: Does the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant. Most versatile reader I've seen and quite classy looking. Instantly recognised when connected and data transfer is fast.Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this card reader cos I had a couple of them, very slow or not working. I was amazed how fast it was and got one for my friend too, he was very happy with it, best he had too. Definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: ... and play no problem loading onto my Mac laptop easy to use great
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play no problem loading onto my Mac laptop easy to use great product
customer_reviews.author: daisyD

product_meta.title: Women Solar System Fox Printed Short Sleeves White Styling Shirts with
product_meta.description: Lexar features a way to easily offload and transfer content to or from your iPhone or iPad with a microSD card. Great for anyone capturing photos or video with a sports camcorder or aerial camera, small, portable design with a Lightning connector. Works with use of free file management app (App Store), and automatically and securely sync files.
feature_bullets: Transfers content to or from your iPhone or iPad via microSD
Works with use of free file management app (App Store)
Great for anyone capturing photos or video with a sports camcorder or aerial camera
Small, portable design with a Lightning connector
Backed by a one-year limited warranty
